body.p: U. S. general and engineer. Clinton, Connecticut, native. Son of Edward Wright and Nancy Wright. Graduated from the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York, in 1841. Married to Louisa M. Wright on August 11, 1842. Father of Louisa M. Wright, Mary H. Wright, Edward B. Wright, Rora L. Wright, and Rosalin Wright. Assistant Professor at U.S. Military Academy. From 1842 to 1844. Member of the Army Corps of Engineers from 1841 to 1884. Served as a 2nd lieutenant from July 1, 1841; 1st lieutenant from February 28, 1848; and captain from July 1, 1855. Assistant to the Board of Engineers. Assistant to the Chief of Corps from 1856 to 1861. Promoted to brigadier general of volunteers on September 14, 1861. Commander of the Department of the Ohio. Appointed major general on May 12, 1864. Commander of U. S. Army Sixth Corps. Commander of the Department of Texas from 1865 to 1866.
